snippet: Holmes and Watson clash with a dominatrix, and with each other, in the new season of “Sherlock” on PBS’s “Masterpiece Mystery!”
abstract: Neil Genzlinger reviews television show Sherlock on PBS series Masterpiece Mystery]. Photo (M)/
lead_paragraph: Crime hasn't disappeared from England as a result of Sherlock Holmes's 21st-century efforts; it has merely become irrelevant. Benedict Cumberbatch, who is back for a new season as Holmes on Sunday on PBS's ''Masterpiece Mystery!,'' is getting so good at his quirky portrayal that the crimes Holmes is solving are a secondary concern. Mr. Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman as Watson are just plain enjoyable to watch. It's all about repartee for these two; theirs is quick and sharp and often comes at the most incongruous moments. In the ''Sherlock'' season premiere Watson is giving the absent Holmes a view of a crime scene via video hookup, but Holmes is proving to be just as annoying on a laptop as he is in person.

headline.main: Holmes and Watson, Back to Bantering
